definition: (modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]

sentences.english: In most British pubs, you have to go to the bar to buy drinks.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数英国酒吧，你得亲自到吧台去买酒。

sentences.english: The second man graciously thanks the first man and continues to the bar.
sentences.chinese: 第二个人很礼貌地感谢了第一个人，继续走向吧台。

sentences.english: Most pubs have no waiters——you have to go to the bar to buy drinks.
sentences.chinese: 大多数英国酒吧都没有酒保，你得到吧台去买酒。

sentences.english: Do you mean the tall gentleman with fair hair and with glasses?
sentences.chinese: 吧台您说的是那位高个子，黄头发，戴眼镜的先生吗？

sentences.english: OK. Neutron walks into a bar and sits down at the bar.
sentences.chinese: 中子走进一个进酒吧，坐在吧台。

sentences.english: Don approaches Clara at the bar.
sentences.chinese: 唐走近吧台旁的克拉拉。

sentences.english: Look at you now, working behind the bar, making cocktails.
sentences.chinese: 转眼间，就看到你在吧台里帮忙做鸡尾酒。

sentences.english: Stools and counters are lined with chrome, the lighting is viscid.
sentences.chinese: 镀铬的凳子和吧台，慵懒的灯光。

sentences.english: The bar is held up by some spare spindles from our spiral staircase.
sentences.chinese: 支撑吧台的是我们的螺旋楼梯上用剩下的支撑轴。

sentences.english: Jack pours two goblets of wine and sits by the bar .
sentences.chinese: 杰克斟上两杯酒，在吧台边上坐下来。

sentences.english: Behind the counter,Gunther cleans the gaudy, oversize mugs and puts them away。
sentences.chinese: 吧台后面，冈瑟擦着华丽的大马克杯并把它们摆放好。

sentences.english: He sat down on his unmade bed and looked at the mini bar.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在凌乱的床上，盯着房间里的迷你吧台。

sentences.english: The only difference is in the restaurant and bar vouchers.
sentences.chinese: 唯一不同的在于餐厅和吧台抵用券。

sentences.english: The bartender said you're the millionaire with the airplane.
sentences.chinese: 吧台说你就是那个有飞机的百万富翁。

sentences.english: Beijia bar at the top of the stainless steel, glass and metal materials contrast.
sentences.chinese: 吧台上方的不锈钢杯架，玻璃与金属的材质对比。

sentences.english: Esquire tumblers chunk on bartops and tables.
sentences.chinese: 绅士酒吧的玻璃酒杯堆放在吧台和桌子上。

definition: small side table/coffee table/teapoy (ornamental tripod with caddies for tea)
private room (in a restaurant, or for karaoke etc)/parlor/booth/compartment
compartment (of train, ship etc)/private room at restaurant/rented room for karaoke/hotel room rented by the hour
drawing room (room for arriving guests)/living room/CL:間|间[jian1]
